artist: Natori Shunsen; Published by Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Lent by Gary and Janet Christenson
description: close-up of woman's face with elaborate hair-do; matted
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
text: Natori Shunsen was one of a small group of 20th century artists who continued the tradition of depicting Kabuki actors in woodblock print form. He became famous for his closely cropped bust portraits of actors in character costume and makeup. This print dates from early in his career, when he produced a series of prints for a short-lived magazine that featured popular Kabuki actors.
title: Illustration from the magazine Portraits of Actors (Yakusha-e)
